excerpt: Half-timbered shrine to the Bard, with memorabilia, period furnishings and changing exhibitions.
detail_description: Shakespeare's Birthplace, located on Henley Street in Stratford-upon-Avon, is a restored 16th-century half-timbered house where William Shakespeare was born and spent his early years. The house features memorabilia, period furnishings, and changing exhibitions related to the Bard.
name: Shakespeare's Birthplace
address: Henley St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6QW, United Kingdom

excerpt: Dedicated to Shakespearean works, this imposing red-brick RSC theater also has a rooftop restaurant.
detail_description: The Royal Shakespeare Theatre, located in Stratford-upon-Avon, is a striking red-brick building dedicated to showcasing Shakespearean works. The theater also features a rooftop restaurant for visitors to enjoy. The venue has received recognition for its architectural design and transformation, with London-based theatre design consultancy Charcoalblues being awarded for their work on the project.
name: Royal Shakespeare Theatre
address: Waterside, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BB, United Kingdom

excerpt: A wattle-and-daub cottage, family home of Shakespeare's wife, with original items of furniture.
detail_description: Anne Hathaway's Cottage, located just a mile outside of the city center in Shottery near Stratford-upon-Avon, is a wattle-and-daub family home that offers visitors a unique insight into the life of William Shakespeare and his wife. The cottage itself is surrounded by idyllic countryside and features original furniture.
name: Anne Hathaway's Cottage
address: 22 Cottage Ln, Shottery, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 9HH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Thousands of butterflies in a rainforest-like greenhouse and rare invertebrates in the Insect City.
detail_description: Located in Stratford-upon-Avon, the Stratford Butterfly Farm is a popular attraction that draws numerous visitors each year. It boasts a rainforest-like greenhouse where thousands of colorful butterflies flutter around. The Insect City houses rare invertebrates, while the discovery zone showcases every stage of the butterfly's life cycle. Additionally, visitors can explore Minibeast Metropolis to encounter snakes, reptiles, amphibians, and other creepy crawlies.
name: Stratford Butterfly Farm
address: Swan's Nest Lane, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 7LS, United Kingdom

excerpt: Interactive exhibits of mechanical art and design with buttons, handles, lights and sound effects.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Stratford upon Avon, The MAD Museum is a unique attraction showcasing interactive mechanical art and design. The museum's exhibits feature buttons, handles, lights, and sound effects that allow visitors to engage with kinetic art and automata. These moving sculptures are sourced from artists worldwide and offer an immersive experience for both children and adults. If you're unfamiliar with mechanical art, think of the whimsical machines seen in Wallace and Gromit or Chitty Chitty Bang Bang.
name: The MAD Museum
address: 4-5, Henley St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6PT, United Kingdom

excerpt: Interactive attraction in a beamed period building with exhibits bringing the 16th century to life.
detail_description: Tudor World, located in a charming old timbered Tudor building on Sheep Street in Stratford-upon-Avon, offers an interactive experience that brings the 16th century to life. Visitors can immerse themselves in historical settings with actors dressed in period attire as guides. The museum also provides opportunities to interact with ghostly figures and even meet a portrayal of William Shakespeare himself. Additionally, guests can join walking tours led by Shakespeare or take part in eerie ghost tours of the haunted mansion.
name: Tudor World
address: 40 Sheep St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6EE, United Kingdom

excerpt: Medieval church with William Shakespeare's grave as well as his baptism and burial records.
detail_description: Holy Trinity Church is a medieval church in Stratford-upon-Avon, known for being the final resting place of William Shakespeare. The church also houses his baptism and burial records. It is one of the must-see attractions in the area, along with other famous sights like Shakespeare Birthplace Trust, Shakespeare's Homes, Tudor World Museum & the Falstaff Experience, and Royal Shakespeare Company (RSC).
name: Holy Trinity Church
address: Old Town, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BG, United Kingdom

excerpt: Exhibits & tours by costumed interpreters of playwright William Shakespeare's medieval classroom.
detail_description: Shakespeare's Schoolroom & Guildhall in Stratford-upon-Avon is a must-visit for enthusiasts seeking the complete Shakespeare experience. Housed in a Grade listed building, this museum offers insights into Shakespeare's formative years and his journey to becoming a renowned playwright. Visitors can engage with costumed interpreters and even try their hand at writing with quill pens and ink, just as Shakespeare did.
name: Shakespeare's Schoolroom & Guildhall
address: Church St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6HB, United Kingdom

excerpt: Museum in 16th-century home of the Bard's neighbour and tours of Shakespeare's Elizabethan garden.
detail_description: Shakespeare's New Place is a historical site in Stratford that was the last residence of William Shakespeare. The property includes a garden that was created in 1756 by Reverend Francis Gastrell, who owned the house at the time. Adjacent to New Place is Nash's House, which has been transformed into a museum showcasing the Tudor period when Shakespeare lived. Additionally, visitors can explore Anne Hathaway's cottage in Shottery and Mary Arden's house in Wilmcote nearby.
name: Shakespeare's New Place
address: 22 Chapel St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6EP, United Kingdom

excerpt: Historic farm with traditional archery and falconry, rare breeds and nature trails to explore.
detail_description: Mary Arden's Farm, located in Wilmcote village just northwest of the River Avon and 3 miles from Stratford, is a historic Tudor-style farmhouse that offers visitors a glimpse into the rural upbringing of William Shakespeare's mother. Managed by the Shakespeare Birthplace Trust, this working Tudor farm allows guests to experience traditional archery and falconry, explore nature trails, and learn about rare breeds.
name: Mary Arden's Farm
address: Station Rd, Wilmcote, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 9UN, United Kingdom

excerpt: Jacobean features and furnishings plus Susanna's husband's medical equipment, books and herb garden.
detail_description: Hall's Croft, located in Stratford-upon-Avon's Old Town, is a historic Jacobean building that was once the residence of John Hall, a local physician who married William Shakespeare's daughter, Susanna. The house features Jacobean furnishings and includes displays of medical equipment, books, and an herb garden that John used for his medicinal treatments. The property has been restored to reflect the 17th-century lifestyle of a physician and his family.
name: Hall's Croft
address: Old Town, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BG, United Kingdom

detail_description: Bancroft Gardens is a picturesque area in Stratford-upon-Avon, offering stunning views of the River Avon and the surrounding countryside. It is home to the Royal Shakespeare Theatre, which has been hosting world-renowned productions since 1879. Visitors can enjoy a meal at the Riverside Cafe or Rooftop Restaurant while taking in the beautiful scenery. The theatre also offers guided tours, providing insight into its backstage areas and costume department.
name: Bancroft Gardens
address: Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BA, United Kingdom

excerpt: Offbeat throwback selling magic wands, wizardry games & butterbeer made from a vintage recipe.
detail_description: Magic Alley is a captivating and enchanting attraction located in Stratford-upon-Avon. This offbeat emporium offers an immersive experience with interactive quests featuring fairies, unicorns, and dragons. Visitors can engage in magical spells and explore a wide array of unique items such as prints, books, candles, games, and gifts. The venue also boasts a potion bar where guests can savor butterbeer made from a vintage recipe.
name: Magic Alley
address: 1st Floor, Bell Ct, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6EX, United Kingdom

detail_description: Located in the town center of Stratford-upon-Avon, The Guild Chapel is a historically significant building with rare medieval wall paintings depicting the afterlife. Built in 1269, it is one of the most beautiful historic buildings in the area and offers free admission for visitors to explore its medieval history.
name: The Guild Chapel
address: Chapel Ln, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6EP, United Kingdom

detail_description: Located at 22 Southern Lane, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BH, The Other Place is the third theater of the Royal Shakespeare Company in Stratford. Originally a tin shed rehearsal room, it was transformed into a studio space in 1974 and has since undergone several changes. In its current form, it serves as a space for learning, research, and rehearsal with a 200-seat studio theatre.
name: The Other Place
address: 22 Southern Ln, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BH, United Kingdom

detail_description: Shakespeare Distillery is a must-visit in Stratford, located at Judiths on No. 1 High Street, the former home of William Shakespeare's daughter Judith. The distillery offers an exciting Cocktail Masterclass and Rum School experience in an opulent upper floor setting. Visitors can enjoy making two different cocktails - one gin and one rum - while learning about their preparation.
name: Shakespeare Distillery
address: Unit A Drayton Manor Dr, Drayton, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 9RQ, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Stratford Upon Avon Ferris Wheel offers an amazing view of the RSC, canal and River Avon. It is open all year round and costs just 6 per person.
name: Stratford Big Wheel
address: National Cycle Rte 41, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 7LS, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Attic Theatre in Stratford-upon-Avon is an award-winning fringe theatre located in Coxs Yard, captivating audiences since 2009. With just over 90 seats, it offers an intimate setting and excellent views of the stage for every theatergoer. The auditorium features original oak beams and eaves from the 15th century timber yard. Productions range from alternative Shakespeare plays to Dracula, Sherlock Holmes, and even a Christmas pantomime.
name: The Attic Theatre
address: Cox's Yard, Bridge Foot, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6YY, United Kingdom

excerpt: Stratford-upon-Avon, a medieval market town in Englands West Midlands, is the 16th-century birthplace of William Shakespeare. Possibly the most famous writer in the English language, Shakespeare is known for his sonnets and plays such as 'Romeo and Juliet' and 'Hamlet'. The Royal Shakespeare Company performs his plays in the Royal Shakespeare Theatre and adjacent Swan Theatre on the banks of the River Avon.
detail_description: Stratford-upon-Avon, a charming medieval market town in England's West Midlands, is renowned as the birthplace of William Shakespeare, the iconic playwright and poet. The Royal Shakespeare Company stages his works at the Royal Shakespeare Theatre and Swan Theatre along the picturesque River Avon. Additionally, visitors can savor exquisite dining experiences at Paul Foster's Michelin-starred restaurant housed in a historic townhouse.
name: Stratford-upon-Avon
address: UK

detail_description: Harvard House, also known as The Ancient House, is a stunning Grade 1 Elizabethan townhouse in Stratford upon Avon. It was rebuilt after the Great Fire in 1594 and was owned by the grandparents of Harvard University's founder. The house boasts intricate architectural features, rich furnishings, and is managed by the Shakespeare Birthplace Trust on behalf of Harvard University. Adjacent to it is a half-timbered home that once belonged to John Harvard's mother.
name: Harvard House
address: 26 High St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6AU, United Kingdom

excerpt: 18th-century pub (formerly known as The Black Swan) popular with actors and serving a global menu.
detail_description: Located in Stratford-upon-Avon, the Dirty Duck, also known as The Black Swan, is an 18th-century pub with a rich history. It has been a popular haunt for actors since the days of David Garrick. The pub offers a global menu and is the only one in Britain to be licensed under two names. Its riverside location near the Royal Shakespeare Theatre makes it a favorite spot for theatergoers and performers looking for pre-show meals or post-performance drinks.
name: Dirty Duck
address: Waterside, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BA, United Kingdom

detail_description: Avon Boating Ltd is a delightful gem in Stratford-upon-Avon, perfect for those looking to enjoy the scenic beauty of this charming town with their furry companions. Established in 1898, Avon Boating invites you to embark on a sightseeing cruise along the picturesque River Avon, where pets are warmly welcomed aboard traditional vessels.
name: Avon Boating Ltd
address: Swans Nest Boathouse, Swans Nest, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 7LS, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Shakespeare Distillery Gin School, established in 2015, offers small batch, high-quality gin inspired by the Tudor period. Located on the outskirts of town, visitors can explore their shop and taste top gins at the High Street location. Additionally, Judiths School of Spirits above the shop provides rum schools, cocktail masterclasses, and gin tasting experiences.
name: Shakespeare Distillery Gin School
address: Unit A Drayton Manor Dr, Drayton, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 9RQ, United Kingdom

detail_description: Stratford Market is a delightful and easily walkable venue, with the main market day being Friday. The market in Rother Street has shifted towards offering high-quality produce and crafts, making it a pleasure to explore. The stalls are lined up along the street, providing views of the park and river just a few feet from nearby shops. Visitors can expect friendly stallholders offering amazing food and quality goods. The market features passionate young vendors showcasing their beautifully arranged stalls, ensuring there's something for everyone.
name: Market
address: Waterside, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6AB, United Kingdom

detail_description: When visiting Stratford-upon-Avon, a must-see is The Swan Theatre, located within the Royal Shakespeare Theatre building on the banks of the River Avon. This intimate venue with 426 seats and 32 standing spaces around a deep thrust stage is highly esteemed by directors, actors, and audiences. You can take a guided tour to see the impressive auditorium or enjoy refreshments at the RSC Riverside Cafe or indulge in a meal at the RSC Rooftop Restaurant.
name: The Swan Theatre
address: Waterside, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 7LS, United Kingdom

detail_description: Located close to the River Avon and just a mile from Stratford-on-Avon town center, Stratford On Avon Racecourse offers a thrilling day out with top jockeys competing for prize money. The racecourse has been operating since 1755 and hosts numerous races during the summer, providing plenty of entertainment for children. The compact layout allows for excellent views of the races, and visitors praise the friendly staff and reasonably priced food.
name: Stratford-upon-Avon Racecourse
address: Office, Luddington Rd, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 9SE, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Gower Memorial, located in Stratford-upon-Avon, is a historic monument unveiled in 1888. It was sculpted by Lord Ronald Gower and features various Shakespearean characters such as Hamlet, Lady Macbeth, Falstaff, and Prince Hal. The memorial was moved to its current location in Bancroft Gardens in 1933 and offers views of the canal and the RSC Swan Theatre.
name: Gower Memorial
address: Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6YY, United Kingdom

excerpt: This rustic-chic restaurant has a riverside terrace and serves Josper-oven steaks and cocktails.
detail_description: Cox's Yard in Stratford-Upon-Avon is a charming riverside restaurant housed in a converted 19th-century warehouse. The rustic-chic eatery offers a fine selection of Josper-oven steaks and cocktails, making it an ideal spot for unwinding along the serene River Avon. The venue pays homage to James Cox, a renowned timber merchant from over 160 years ago, known for providing materials used in constructing historic buildings across the town.
name: Cox's Yard, Stratford-Upon-Avon
address: Bridge Foot, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6YY, United Kingdom

detail_description: Shakespeare's England encompasses the charming locales of Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwick, Kenilworth, Royal Leamington Spa, and nearby towns. Nestled in the heart of England, this region is renowned for its rich history and picturesque landscapes. Visitors can indulge in delightful cuisine and enjoy a tranquil atmosphere while exploring the area's attractions. It's a wonderful destination for those seeking a blend of history, culture, and relaxation.
name: Visit Shakespeare's England
address: Elizabeth House, Church St, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6HX, United Kingdom

excerpt: Vintage-themed cafe with secluded tea terrace and large garden with an original Anderson shelter.
detail_description: The Fourteas Tea-Room Brasserie in Stratford-Upon-Avon offers a unique vintage-themed experience, celebrating the 1940s with music, costumes, and a menu designed to resemble a ration book. The owner's background at The Ritz in London is evident in the attention to detail. Housed in a 500-year-old townhouse just 100 meters from The Royal Shakespeare Theatre, this tea room provides an immersive experience without feeling like a mere theme cafe.
name: The Fourteas Tea-Room Brasserie
address: 24 Sheep St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6EF, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Recreation Ground, also known as "The Rec," is a popular outdoor space in Stratford-upon-Avon. It's a favorite among locals for leisurely walks along the river Avon, picnics, and even playing chess on concrete boards. The area hosts summer concerts and festivals, offering various activities such as a paddling pool, bowling club, crazy golf course, and several cafes and bars. Visitors can also enjoy watching swans but should be cautious of their territorial behavior.
name: The Recreation Ground
address: Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 7LS, United Kingdom

detail_description: Stratford Play House is a popular venue located in the heart of the bustling Recreation Ground, just a short stroll from the Royal Shakespeare Theatre. The theater offers excellent acoustics and features a bar for guests to enjoy. While some visitors recommend choosing tiered seating for an unobstructed view of the stage, others suggest opting for floor seating or middle-tiered seats for a great experience.
name: Stratford Play House
address: Suite 14, 14 Rother St, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6LU, United Kingdom

detail_description: Shakespaw Cat Cafe, located in Stratford-upon-Avon, is a unique destination for cat lovers. This Midlands' first cat cafe features cats named after Shakespeare characters and offers a 90-minute visit for a nominal fee. Visitors can enjoy tea, coffee, cake, or even cocktails while spending time with the resident felines. The cafe provides a relaxing environment and serves as a temporary home for adorable rescue cats who are looking for their forever families.
name: Shakespaw Cat Cafe.
address: 6 Union St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6QT, United Kingdom

detail_description: Canal and River Tours Ltd is a sightseeing tour agency that offers 45 minute tours of the canal basin, waterside, Stratford upon Avon, and the surrounding area. The company employs leading actors to narrate the tours in standard English, ensuring that each visitor can learn about Stratford's history and wildlife while enjoying a stroll through the town.
name: Canal and River Tours Ltd
address: Waterside, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6AT, United Kingdom

detail_description: Discover the history and connection of Stratford-upon-Avon with William Shakespeare by joining the informative and entertaining Stratford Town Walk. The two-hour guided walk takes you to significant places such as Shakespeare's birthplace, burial site, and his daughter's house. No pre-booking is required for tours that run daily at specific times. For a different experience, join the spooky evening adventure of the Stratford Ghost Walk where professional entertainers share ghost stories and legends while strolling through atmospheric buildings.
name: Stratford Town Walk and Stratford Ghost Walk
address: on Waterside, opposite the junction of, Sheep St, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6BA, United Kingdom

detail_description: Stratford-upon-Avon Library & Registration Service is located in the picturesque town of Stratford-upon-Avon, known as the birthplace of William Shakespeare. This historic town offers a rich cultural experience with its well-preserved timber-framed buildings and stunning architecture. Visitors can explore Shakespeare's houses, beautiful parks, and gardens while enjoying various dining and accommodation options. The town also boasts the renowned Royal Shakespeare Theatre Company.
name: Stratford-upon-Avon Library & Registration Service
address: 12 Henley St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6PZ, United Kingdom

detail_description: Bancroft Basin, located between the RSC theatre and the main area of town along the canal, offers a picturesque waterside garden ideal for picnics and hosts various activities and events. Visitors can enjoy a market with handmade gifts several times a week. The basin is surrounded by gardens, the Shakespeare Royal Theatre, and numerous coffee and food shops. Additionally, tourists can take boat rides on the Avon River from Lock 56.
name: Bancroft Basin- Stratford Canal
address: 69 National Cycle Rte 41, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6AT, United Kingdom

excerpt: Neapolitan and British art in a Georgian stately home in 120 acres landscaped by Capability Brown.
detail_description: Compton Verney Art Gallery and Park is a stunning destination that combines Neapolitan and British art in a Georgian stately home set within 120 acres of landscaped grounds designed by Capability Brown. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks through the picturesque parkland, taking in breathtaking views of the mansion house, lake, and surrounding countryside. The outdoor art exhibitions offer a unique experience for art enthusiasts.
name: Compton Verney
address: B4086, CV35 9HZ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Church-floor funerary monument for famed poet & playwright William Shakespeare, buried here in 1616.
detail_description: The Holy Trinity Church is the birthplace of William Shakespeare and it was also where he was buried after he died. The church features a beautiful funerary monument for the famous playwright which includes a figure of him holding a pen and paper.
name: Shakespeare's Funerary Monument
address: 1 Old Town, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6BG, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Jester Statue is a monument in London designed by British artist David Stone Martin. It is a bronze sculpture of a jester, which people can sit on and are posed to encourage visitors to have a laugh. The statue was commissioned by the advertising company JWT and unveiled in 2003.
name: The Jester
address: Windsor St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6NL, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Shakespeare Memorial Fountain is a beautifully ornate Victorian Gothic clock tower in Stratford-upon-Avon, England, gifted to the town by American publisher George W Childs in 1887 to mark Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee. It is engraved with quotations from Shakespeare plays and functions as both a rather dramatic clock tower and an ornate memorial to one of the most famous writers in history. The fountain is open daily and admission is free.
name: The Shakespeare Memorial Fountain
address: Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6JF, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Bear Pit Theatre is a small, intimate theater company that specializes in comedies. They had a great time seeing "Nevilles Island" and were very surprised by the reasonable prices at the bar area. Remember to bring your own cup if you want to take your drinks into the theater!
name: The Bear Pit Theatre
address: Rother St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6LU, United Kingdom

excerpt: Collections of WWII bombers, artillery, a trebuchet, model soldiers and restaurant on 86-acre site.
detail_description: Stratford Armouries, located just outside Stratford-Upon-Avon, is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and families alike. This museum boasts an impressive collection of WWII bombers, artillery, model soldiers, and even a trebuchet on its 86-acre site. Visitors can explore the vivid history of World War II and marvel at the detailed exhibits, including a paper scene depicting a WW1 trench and the remains of an actual Wellington bomber.
name: Stratford Armouries
address: Hawkeswood, Gospel Oak Ln, Pathlow, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 0JA, United Kingdom

detail_description: Situated on Bridge Street near the canal basin, the Stratford-upon-Avon Tourist Information Centre is a convenient hub for gathering tourist leaflets and receiving assistance from friendly staff. The center operates daily, offering valuable information and suggestions to visitors. It's also a place to purchase tickets for activities like the hop-on-hop-off bus tour.
name: Stratford-upon-Avon Tourist Information Centre
address: Bridge Foot, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6GW, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Bancroft Basin is a popular tourist attraction in the town of Kinross. It's perfect for a peaceful evening picnic, with its pretty waterside garden and market. There are also short boat trips along the canal available.
name: Bancroft Basin
address: Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6YY, United Kingdom

detail_description: Garden of Remembrance is a tranquil memorial park near Holy Trinity Church in Stratford Upon Avon. It features a dedicatory plaque honoring two brothers who lost their lives in World War 2. The park provides a peaceful setting for contemplation and remembrance of the sacrifices made by members of the Armed Forces throughout different wars and conflicts. It's described as a small, peaceful garden perfect for quiet reflection.
name: Garden of Remembrance
address: Old Town House, 21 College St, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6BN, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Catholic church St. Gregory the Great in Stratford Upon Avon is a welcoming place with a friendly Fr. Alex who is looking forward to finishing the upcoming redecorating work. The church is located close to the city centre and has ample parking available.
name: St Gregory the Great Roman Catholic Church
address: Welcombe Rd, Warwickshire, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6UJ, United Kingdom

detail_description: Gilly's Disc Golf course is an outstanding and enjoyable destination for both beginners and professionals. Its various tee options provide a fun experience for novices while presenting a genuine challenge for experienced players. The remarkable effort put into creating this successful course is evident, with continuous improvements enhancing the overall experience each time one visits. The amenities such as the parking area, shop, pathways, and signage contribute to making it an excellent venue for a day of golfing.
name: Gilly's Disc Golf
address: Wayfield Gorse, Gospel Oak Ln, CV37 0JA, United Kingdom

name: Stratford Fountains
address: Othello House, Stratford Business & Technology Park, Banbury Rd, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 7GY, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Montpellier Gallery is an independent art gallery in the city of Montpellier, France. It has a wide range of local artisan work, and is highly recommended. The staff are friendly and well informed, and the collection is very lovely.
name: Montpellier Gallery
address: 8 Chapel St, Stratford-upon-Avon, CV37 6EP, United Kingdom
